title: Merge pull request #32 from baz8080/baz8080/increase-coverage
message:
Merge pull request #32 from baz8080/baz8080/increase-coverage

Increase test coverage

title: Increases unit-test coverage, does required refectoring, and updates libraries
message:
Increases unit-test coverage, does required refectoring, and updates libraries

Add basic tests for MainModel, and refactor to support this

clean up

Make the initial search explicit, and not a side-effect of init

Previously the init method in MainPresenter would trigger a search for the empty string, which is treated as "give me the first 50 results". I prefer to move it out of init, and have it being a more explicit call by the view.

Add some happy-path tests for MainPresenter

Added some unit tests for MainPresenter to cover the very happy parts. Some refactoring will be needed to improve the testability here. See the TODO in MainPresenter::search

Library updates

Use the latest version on maven central for mockito

title: Adds a feature that allows TTS on the list view
message:
Adds a feature that allows TTS on the list view

* Added 24dp assets for the play icon
* Changed adapter to use presenter rather than directly call tts, word detail
* Added appropriate methods to presenter and view to facilitate the feature
* Moved low volume warning to MainApplication::speak

title: Adds more tests for text to speech operations
message:
Adds more tests for text to speech operations

Tests were added to cover language switching, and to ensure that the correct parameters are passed to the speak method.

The Answers reporting was wrapped in a Fabric.isInitialized because it's not initialised during unit testing, and was causing an Exception.

title: Merge pull request #28 from baz8080/baz8080/tts-improvements
message:
Merge pull request #28 from baz8080/baz8080/tts-improvements

Fixes the TTS crash in MainApplication

title: Wrap Android's TextToSpeech with FolketsTextToSpeech
message:
Wrap Android's TextToSpeech with FolketsTextToSpeech

I have been getting a couple of crashes around TTS, so I decided to wrap the TTS and make it more testable.

Sad-path tests have been added for a sense of safety around nullability and unavailability.

title: Added a feature to warn users when TTS volume is too low to hear the word
message:
Added a feature to warn users when TTS volume is too low to hear the word

* Added a check to WordActivity when TTS is requested. It will warn users when the volume for STREAM_MUSIC is zero, meaning they definitely won't hear the word that TTS is saying.
